text:
A rhyming couplet:
A map was pinned behind the shelf,
She peeled it off and read it for herself.

A rhyming couplet:
He closed the book and rubbed his eyes,
The ending came as no surprise.

A rhyming couplet:
The alley smelled of oil and grease,
A world away from any peace.

A rhyming couplet:
A church bell chimed the stroke of noon,
The pigeons scattered very soon.

A rhyming couplet:
The swing set creaked beneath her weight,
She pumped her legs and swung up straight.

A rhyming couplet:
A fallen log had bridged the ditch,
Its surface mossy, green and rich.

A rhyming couplet:
A troll sat underneath the bridge,
Beside the mossy mountain ridge.

A rhyming couplet:
The laboratory smelled of smoke,
When every flask and beaker broke.

A rhyming couplet:
The acorns crunched beneath his boot,
Beside a thick and twisted root.

A rhyming couplet:
She jumped the rope and counted ten,
Then started over once again.

A rhyming couplet:
He sliced the cheese and poured the wine,
And set the table out to dine.

A rhyming couplet:
He balanced books until the dawn,
And yawned the biggest, deepest yawn.

A rhyming couplet:
She fed the chickens grain and corn,
The same routine since she was born.

A rhyming couplet:
The king sat high upon his throne,
And ruled the land he called his own.

A rhyming couplet:
A thermometer read below,
The temperature of falling snow.

A rhyming couplet:
A poet searched for one more word,
The finest verse not yet been heard.

A rhyming couplet:
She hailed a cab beneath the rain,
And disappeared down Fifth again.

A rhyming couplet:
The carpenter sanded every plank,
Until the wood was smooth and blank.

A rhyming couplet:
The vines had climbed the garden wall,
And bloomed in red before the fall.

A rhyming couplet:
The wind had rattled every pane,
And howled through every weathervane.

A rhyming couplet:
He solved the riddle on the scroll,
The answer hidden in a hole.

A rhyming couplet:
The taxi honked and changed its lane,
Through every block and one-way chain.

A rhyming couplet:
A pinwheel spun with every gust,
Its paper faded, flecked with dust.

A rhyming couplet:
A princess locked inside the tower,
Had waited there for many an hour.

A rhyming couplet:
She packed a bag with map and flask,
And set out on the daunting task.

A rhyming couplet:
The diver checked his tank and mask,
And plunged into the final task.

A rhyming couplet:
The spelling bee came down to two,
And neither one knew what to do.

A rhyming couplet:
A whirlwind tore across the plain,
And scattered every stack of grain.

A rhyming couplet:
The telescope revealed a ring,
Around the planet's distant swing.

A rhyming couplet:
A dove sat cooing on the ledge,
Beside the garden's thorny hedge.

A rhyming couplet:
The birthday candles filled the room with light,
She closed her eyes and wished with all her might.

A rhyming couplet:
She hung the laundry on the line,
And hoped tomorrow would be fine.

A rhyming couplet:
A marble rolled across the floor,
And vanished underneath the door.

A rhyming couplet:
He mopped the kitchen, scrubbed the sink,
And poured himself a cold, tall drink.

A rhyming couplet:
The ivy climbed the crumbling tower,
And blossomed with a purple flower.

A rhyming couplet:
A promise made beneath the stars,
Outlasted every wound and scar.

A rhyming couplet:
He shoveled snow until his back,
Was sore and stiff along the track.

A rhyming couplet:
He knelt before the royal chair,
And pledged his sword beyond compare.

A rhyming couplet:
The brownstone steps were warm with sun,
Where neighbors met when day was done.

A rhyming couplet:
A cliff rose high above the bay,
Where seabirds circled every day.

A rhyming couplet:
The castle floated in the sky,
Too high for any bird to fly.

A rhyming couplet:
The bridge connected shore to shore,
A path that millions traveled for.

A rhyming couplet:
The seafloor glittered full of pearl,
A treasure no one dared unfurl.

A rhyming couplet:
He leaned against the old brick wall,
And watched the autumn leaves turn fall.

A rhyming couplet:
She wound the watch her father made,
Its silver face would never fade.

A rhyming couplet:
He bargained with the demon's ghost,
And lost the thing he loved the most.

A rhyming couplet:
He cast a spell to freeze the flame,
And nothing ever burned the same.

A rhyming couplet:
A pillow fight had filled the room,
With feathers floating like soft plume.

A rhyming couplet:
A treehouse sat above the yard,
Its ladder old, its planks were scarred.

A rhyming couplet:
He chased the fireflies at dusk,
Their glow like tiny sparks of musk.

A rhyming couplet:
He walked the cobblestones at dusk,
The evening air was warm and musk.

A rhyming couplet:
He packed his trunk and caught the train,
And never saw that town again.

A rhyming couplet:
He oiled the gears and turned the crank,
The engine sputtered, coughed and sank.

A rhyming couplet:
A hot-air balloon rose up at dawn,
Above the fields of golden corn.

A rhyming couplet:
A singer's voice rang through the hall,
And hushed the crowd from wall to wall.

A rhyming couplet:
The rocket launched without a flaw,
The crowd below just stood in awe.

A rhyming couplet:
He plastered every crack and seam,
Until the wall was white and clean.

A rhyming couplet:
He traced the coastline on his chart,
And planned the journey from the start.

A rhyming couplet:
A riptide pulled him off the sand,
Too strong for him to reach the land.

A rhyming couplet:
A scarf she'd knitted, red and warm,
Had kept him safe through every storm.

A rhyming couplet:
She found a penny on the ground,
The shiniest she'd ever found.

A rhyming couplet:
The greenhouse sheltered every sprout,
From winter's chill and summer's drought.

A rhyming couplet:
She cracked the eggs into the flour,
And mixed the batter for an hour.

A rhyming couplet:
The tailor hemmed the velvet gown,
The finest dress in all the town.

A rhyming couplet:
The crown was set with ruby stone,
A gem the kingdom called its own.

A rhyming couplet:
The dancer spun across the stage,
With grace that seemed to defy age.

A rhyming couplet:
A pelican dove into the sea,
And caught a fish with practiced glee.

A rhyming couplet:
He sent a letter every week,
The words too fragile, soft and meek.

A rhyming couplet:
He peeled the orange in a ring,
A perfect curl of everything.

A rhyming couplet:
A shadow crept along the floor,
And vanished underneath the door.

A rhyming couplet:
He scribbled notes in tiny scrawl,
Too small to read across the hall.

A rhyming couplet:
The scarecrow's coat was torn to shreds,
The crows had nested on its head.

A rhyming couplet:
He fixed the plow with bolt and wrench,
And sharpened blades upon the bench.

A rhyming couplet:
A windmill turned against the sky,
Its arms like wings about to fly.

A rhyming couplet:
A rainbow arched from east to west,
The storm had passed and gone to rest.

A rhyming couplet:
A clearing opened in the wood,
Where once a tiny cottage stood.

A rhyming couplet:
She passed the bakery each day,
Its scent enough to make her stay.

A rhyming couplet:
She wove a tapestry of thread,
With every color ever bred.

A rhyming couplet:
The postcard came from overseas,
With photographs of palms and seas.

A rhyming couplet:
A cello hummed a mournful tone,
As if it played for grief alone.

A rhyming couplet:
The war had ended with a truce,
But peace was hanging by a noose.

A rhyming couplet:
The mossy bank was slick and green,
The prettiest place she'd ever seen.

A rhyming couplet:
He grilled the fish upon the coal,
And served it steaming in a bowl.

A rhyming couplet:
A pumpkin grew beside the shed,
Its vine had sprawled and wildly spread.

A rhyming couplet:
The well was deep and lined with stone,
Its water cold down to the bone.

A rhyming couplet:
The honey dripped from every comb,
A golden treasure brought back home.

A rhyming couplet:
The meadow stretched for miles ahead,
With poppies burning bright and red.

A rhyming couplet:
A passport stamped in fading ink,
Brought memories to every blink.

A rhyming couplet:
He hid the jewels beneath the floor,
Behind a hidden chamber door.

A rhyming couplet:
The turret overlooked the land,
For miles of forest, field and sand.

A rhyming couplet:
A backpack heavy, boots worn thin,
She smiled and said let's start again.

A rhyming couplet:
He pedaled fast along the lane,
With playing cards clipped to the frame.

A rhyming couplet:
The streetlamp flickered in the rain,
Its light reflected on the lane.

A rhyming couplet:
The coral reef was bright with life,
With color sharp as any knife.

A rhyming couplet:
She heard the owl begin to call,
As shadows crept along the wall.

A rhyming couplet:
She carved a notch on every tree,
To mark the path and keep it free.

A rhyming couplet:
The mural stretched from floor to sky,
A hundred colors caught the eye.

A rhyming couplet:
He followed muddy tracks inside,
That someone tried so hard to hide.

A rhyming couplet:
The castle walls were ten feet thick,
But fire burned through every brick.

A rhyming couplet:
A knight rode out at break of dawn,
Before the castle's bridge was drawn.

A rhyming couplet:
The staircase creaked beneath her feet,
With every slow and cautious beat.

A rhyming couplet:
He chopped the firewood stump by stump,
And stacked it in a tidy clump.

A rhyming couplet:
The feast was set with meat and ale,
Enough to fill the grandest tale.

A rhyming couplet:
The lumberjack swung at the trunk,
The ax went deep with every chunk.

A rhyming couplet:
She pressed the flower in a book,
A keepsake she was scared to look.

A rhyming couplet:
A soldier wrote his final note,
And tucked it in his dusty coat.

A rhyming couplet:
The portal shimmered blue and bright,
And pulled them through to endless night.

A rhyming couplet:
The chocolate melted in the bowl,
Its sweetness warming up her soul.

A rhyming couplet:
A scout returned with urgent news,
The enemy had changed their views.

A rhyming couplet:
She combed the wool from every sheep,
And spun it on a spindle deep.

A rhyming couplet:
The fog was thick along the coast,
And swallowed every sign and post.

A rhyming couplet:
The atlas showed a land unknown,
A place where seeds had never sown.

A rhyming couplet:
The gallery was hung with art,
Each painting showing someone's heart.

A rhyming couplet:
A woodpecker drummed on the bark,
Its rhythm echoing through the dark.

A rhyming couplet:
The warlock's curse had turned the land,
To nothing more than dust and sand.

A rhyming couplet:
The seaweed clung to every rope,
As sailors held to every hope.

A rhyming couplet:
The orchard bent with fruit and weight,
The harvest came a week too late.

A rhyming couplet:
A sketch was drawn in charcoal black,
Of every detail in the shack.

A rhyming couplet:
He stacked the blocks up to his chin,
And watched them topple once again.

A rhyming couplet:
She picked a daisy from the field,
Its petals soft, its stem concealed.

A rhyming couplet:
The miner dug for precious ore,
A mile beneath the forest floor.

A rhyming couplet:
The power went out in the storm,
She lit a candle to stay warm.

A rhyming couplet:
The horse galloped across the plain,
Its black mane flying in the rain.

A rhyming couplet:
She kissed the frog beside the well,
And broke the cunning witch's spell.

A rhyming couplet:
The cider pressed from autumn fruit,
Was sweet from apple down to root.

A rhyming couplet:
The dryer buzzed and came to rest,
She folded every shirt and vest.

A rhyming couplet:
The fishing village smelled of brine,
Where nets were hung on every line.

A rhyming couplet:
He pulled the curtains open wide,
And let the morning step inside.

A rhyming couplet:
He fell beside the broken gate,
A soldier given up to fate.

A rhyming couplet:
The potion glowed a vivid green,
The strangest color ever seen.

A rhyming couplet:
A beehive hummed beside the gate,
Its honey sweet, its guard irate.

A rhyming couplet:
He gathered kindling for the fire,
And stacked the branches ever higher.

A rhyming couplet:
A fire hydrant sprayed the street,
And cooled the kids in summer heat.

A rhyming couplet:
She turned the wheel to shape the clay,
And spun it gently through the day.

A rhyming couplet:
She listened to the whispering pines,
Their voices woven through the vines.

A rhyming couplet:
A graffiti mural stretched the block,
Painted over every lock.

A rhyming couplet:
She sat beside the fountain's edge,
And balanced on the marble ledge.

A rhyming couplet:
The sunflowers faced the morning east,
The tallest was a golden beast.

A rhyming couplet:
He drew the map of every hall,
And sketched the layout wall by wall.

A rhyming couplet:
The runway stretched into the haze,
The start of yet another phase.

A rhyming couplet:
She followed tracks along the dirt,
The prints were fresh and on alert.

A rhyming couplet:
A mouse scurried across the floor,
And disappeared beneath the door.

A rhyming couplet:
She wore a gown of emerald green,
The finest that the court had seen.

A rhyming couplet:
He caught a toad beside the creek,
And held it gently on his cheek.

A rhyming couplet:
The drawbridge rose with heavy chain,
No army would get through again.

A rhyming couplet:
A monsoon battered every roof,
The river rising as the proof.

A rhyming couplet:
The scroll was brittle, old and brown,
The oldest artifact in town.

A rhyming couplet:
He calibrated every lens,
To watch the starlight's journey's ends.

A rhyming couplet:
The captain stood upon the deck,
And steered his ship through storm and wreck.

A rhyming couplet:
A drumbeat echoed in the night,
And called the soldiers back to fight.

A rhyming couplet:
A comet blazed across the sky,
Too fast for any naked eye.

A rhyming couplet:
The orchestra began to play,
The overture to close the day.

A rhyming couplet:
The fortress fell at break of day,
Its walls reduced to dust and clay.

A rhyming couplet:
A bookmark held the reader's place,
With just a ribbon's thin embrace.

A rhyming couplet:
The dough had risen through the night,
By morning it was soft and light.

A rhyming couplet:
A cricket chirped behind the wall,
The only sound in evening's hall.

A rhyming couplet:
The choir sang in perfect tune,
Beneath the pale December moon.

A rhyming couplet:
The sailor watched the rolling tide,
And steered his vessel far and wide.

A rhyming couplet:
A locksmith turned his tiny pick,
The mechanism gave a click.

A rhyming couplet:
She lit the signal at the tower,
And help arrived within the hour.

A rhyming couplet:
The garbage truck rolled down the lane,
Its rumble like a passing train.

A rhyming couplet:
The pianist struck a minor chord,
That left the audience floored.

A rhyming couplet:
She sprinkled cinnamon and spice,
And stirred the bubbling pot of rice.

A rhyming couplet:
He mixed the chemicals with care,
A toxic vapor filled the air.

A rhyming couplet:
A lighthouse flashed across the bay,
And guided ships along their way.

A rhyming couplet:
She measured twice and cut the board,
A craftsman's rule she'd always stored.

A rhyming couplet:
A trolley clanged along the track,
And slowly brought the commuters back.

A rhyming couplet:
A herald blew the silver horn,
To greet the prince who'd just been born.

A rhyming couplet:
She whispered secrets to her doll,
The dearest friend she had of all.

A rhyming couplet:
The hotel lobby gleamed with brass,
Its floors were polished smooth as glass.

A rhyming couplet:
She recognized him by his walk,
Before they'd had a chance to talk.

A rhyming couplet:
She read the scroll the bishop sent,
And wondered what the message meant.

A rhyming couplet:
The garlic sizzled in the pan,
The kitchen smelled the way it can.

A rhyming couplet:
A nomad pitched his weathered tent,
Content with every mile he went.

A rhyming couplet:
He strummed the strings of his guitar,
Beneath the light of every star.

A rhyming couplet:
The labyrinth was dark and wide,
With monsters lurking deep inside.

A rhyming couplet:
She kept the locket by her heart,
A gift received before the start.

A rhyming couplet:
A neon sign buzzed on and off,
Above the bar called Silver Loft.

A rhyming couplet:
She locked the door and turned the key,
And walked toward the old oak tree.

A rhyming couplet:
The lantern swung from side to side,
Revealing what the dark would hide.

A rhyming couplet:
A mercenary sold his steel,
To any lord who'd make a deal.

A rhyming couplet:
The spring had come to melt the ice,
And everything looked warm and nice.

A rhyming couplet:
The tide pools teemed with tiny life,
From shrimp to snail to sea-star rife.

A rhyming couplet:
A geode cracked revealed a prize,
Of purple crystal, bright to eyes.

A rhyming couplet:
A gargoyle woke upon the wall,
And spread its wings before the fall.

A rhyming couplet:
She blew the dandelion's seed,
And watched it fly with gentle speed.

A rhyming couplet:
A globe was spinning on its stand,
She traced the oceans with her hand.

A rhyming couplet:
A lightning bolt lit up the night,
And split the oak tree left and right.

A rhyming couplet:
She dusted sugar on the tart,
A little sweetness from the heart.

A rhyming couplet:
The chamber pot was made of gold,
A luxury for kings of old.

A rhyming couplet:
The potter glazed the finished vase,
And set it in its proper place.

A rhyming couplet:
He memorized the periodic chart,
And knew each element by heart.

A rhyming couplet:
He chiseled marble into form,
A statue standing through the storm.

A rhyming couplet:
The puppet danced on strings of thread,
And bowed its tiny wooden head.

A rhyming couplet:
A vendor shouted from his cart,
He'd been there selling from the start.

A rhyming couplet:
The pine trees swayed beneath the breeze,
And shed their needles by degrees.

A rhyming couplet:
The throne was carved from solid oak,
And creaked each time the monarch spoke.

A rhyming couplet:
She bound the pages of the book,
With care in every stitch she took.

A rhyming couplet:
A blanket fort blocked out the light,
The perfect place to spend the night.

A rhyming couplet:
The desert stretched without a tree,
As far as anyone could see.

A rhyming couplet:
The canyon echoed every sound,
For miles and miles below the ground.

A rhyming couplet:
She peeled the wallpaper away,
And found a door of painted gray.

A rhyming couplet:
He pulled the sword from solid stone,
And claimed the right to take the throne.

A rhyming couplet:
A fox den hid beneath the slope,
Barely visible in scope.

A rhyming couplet:
A feast was set for forty guests,
With roasted meats and buttered breasts.

A rhyming couplet:
He carried nothing but a sword,
And fought for something more than lord.

A rhyming couplet:
She smelled the perfume in the room,
A stranger's scent, a faded bloom.

A rhyming couplet:
The parrot mimicked every phrase,
And earned its keeper's fond amaze.

A rhyming couplet:
A kraken lurked beneath the keel,
Its tentacles as hard as steel.

A rhyming couplet:
He carved a face from block of wood,
As lifelike as a portrait could.

A rhyming couplet:
A donkey brayed beneath the hill,
Its voice rang loud across the still.

A rhyming couplet:
He drew his bowstring to his cheek,
The arrow flew across the creek.

A rhyming couplet:
She swept the dust beneath the rug,
And poured the coffee in a mug.

A rhyming couplet:
A dolphin leapt above the bow,
As graceful as the waves allow.

A rhyming couplet:
A swarm of bees had found the hive,
And kept the honey store alive.

A rhyming couplet:
The typewriter began to clack,
Though no one touched a single black.

A rhyming couplet:
She sculpted clay with careful hands,
And shaped a figure no one plans.

A rhyming couplet:
She closed the shutters one by one,
Before the worst had yet begun.

A rhyming couplet:
A traveler knocked at midnight's bell,
With tales of wonder he would tell.

A rhyming couplet:
A broken pipe had soaked the floor,
The plumber knocked upon the door.

A rhyming couplet:
A gondola crossed the silver lake,
Its wooden frame began to shake.

A rhyming couplet:
A pebble tumbled down the hill,
And landed in a stream so still.

A rhyming couplet:
He kissed her cheek beneath the elm,
A moment no one could overwhelm.

A rhyming couplet:
The compass needle pointed north,
And so the fleet set bravely forth.

A rhyming couplet:
She found a ring of ancient gold,
That did exactly what it's told.

A rhyming couplet:
A street performer played the blues,
With nothing left and all to lose.

A rhyming couplet:
He polished every link of chain,
And marched into the war again.

A rhyming couplet:
A river carved its way through stone,
And traveled on its path alone.

A rhyming couplet:
A wedding ring was lost in sand,
She searched with every trembling hand.

A rhyming couplet:
A locket opened with a spring,
Inside it held a curious thing.

A rhyming couplet:
A minstrel sang of battles won,
From dusk until the rising sun.

A rhyming couplet:
A flag still flew above the gate,
Defiant in the face of fate.

A rhyming couplet:
The waves had battered every dock,
And left the harbor stripped to rock.

A rhyming couplet:
She played a tune upon the drum,
Until the dancing crowd grew numb.

A rhyming couplet:
A crystal ball revealed the truth,
About a long-forgotten youth.

A rhyming couplet:
He studied atoms, small and strange,
Their particles beyond all range.

A rhyming couplet:
A tear slid down without a sound,
The heaviest weight she'd ever found.

A rhyming couplet:
A seamstress cut the pattern clean,
The sharpest scissors ever seen.

A rhyming couplet:
The harbor lights began to gleam,
Like something from a sailor's dream.

A rhyming couplet:
A goose chased children round the yard,
Its temper fierce and hitting hard.

A rhyming couplet:
The castle stood behind a moat,
Too wide to cross by bridge or boat.

A rhyming couplet:
He tiled the roof from edge to peak,
The labor lasting through the week.

A rhyming couplet:
The birch trees shimmered silver-white,
Their bark reflecting morning light.

A rhyming couplet:
The lecture hall was dim and vast,
The hour feeling like the last.

A rhyming couplet:
A teacher wrote upon the board,
A lesson no one could afford.

A rhyming couplet:
The orchard bent with apple's weight,
Too heavy for the wooden crate.

A rhyming couplet:
A spider spun a silver thread,
Between the roses and the shed.

A rhyming couplet:
He missed the bus by half a beat,
And ran the whole way down the street.

A rhyming couplet:
The oracle spoke in ancient rhyme,
And warned of dangers yet to climb.

A rhyming couplet:
The pub was warm with fire and cheer,
They toasted mugs of frothy beer.

A rhyming couplet:
A unicorn stood in the glade,
Its silver horn began to fade.

A rhyming couplet:
The hilltop caught the setting sun,
And glowed as if the day had won.

A rhyming couplet:
The throne room gleamed with marble floor,
As nobles entered through the door.

A rhyming couplet:
The spellbook crumbled page by page,
Consumed by time and bitter age.

A rhyming couplet:
He sowed the seeds in tidy rows,
And watered every sprout that grows.

A rhyming couplet:
The diner served him eggs and toast,
The thing the travelers loved the most.

A rhyming couplet:
The mountain peak was capped with snow,
While warm winds swept the vale below.

A rhyming couplet:
A hawk dove down without a sound,
And snatched its prey from off the ground.

A rhyming couplet:
The rocking chair creaked back and forth,
Beside the window facing north.

A rhyming couplet:
He noticed every lock was turned,
And something in the fireplace burned.

A rhyming couplet:
The shield was dented, cracked and worn,
From every battle it had borne.

A rhyming couplet:
He chased his hat blown by the gale,
Down every hill and over dale.

A rhyming couplet:
She dipped her brush into the red,
And painted roses on the bed.

A rhyming couplet:
He built a castle out of sand,
With towers shaped by tiny hands.

A rhyming couplet:
The market square was loud and bright,
With lanterns glowing in the night.

A rhyming couplet:
The cabin sat beside the trail,
With chimney smoke and wooden rail.

A rhyming couplet:
He stacked the cordwood by the door,
Enough to last through winter's floor.

A rhyming couplet:
A mermaid sang beneath the tide,
Her voice could not be held inside.

A rhyming couplet:
The siege had lasted forty days,
The city burned in orange haze.

A rhyming couplet:
She stitched the button back in place,
A tiny fix with quiet grace.

A rhyming couplet:
The window shattered in the night,
Though nothing else was quite in sight.

A rhyming couplet:
The bridge above the gorge was old,
Its planks were rotten, cracked and cold.

A rhyming couplet:
The swamp was thick with fog and reeds,
A hiding place for secret deeds.

A rhyming couplet:
She spotted antlers in the mist,
A sight too fleeting to resist.

A rhyming couplet:
He reached for her across the crowd,
But couldn't say her name aloud.

A rhyming couplet:
The blizzard buried every track,
And left no simple pathway back.

A rhyming couplet:
The witch stirred herbs into her brew,
And chanted words that no one knew.

A rhyming couplet:
A pinecone tumbled from above,
Dropped by a scolding mourning dove.

A rhyming couplet:
The roofer hammered every shingle,
Until the echo ceased to mingle.

A rhyming couplet:
He borrowed books he'd never read,
And stacked them high beside his bed.

A rhyming couplet:
A moth flew circles round the flame,
It didn't know the deadly game.

A rhyming couplet:
A page delivered royal mail,
Through every chamber, hall and trail.

A rhyming couplet:
A ticket punched for parts unknown,
The farthest place he'd ever flown.

A rhyming couplet:
A hollow tree held secrets deep,
Where squirrels stored their winter's keep.

A rhyming couplet:
The chalkboard filled with numbers wide,
The students watching, eagle-eyed.

A rhyming couplet:
He shaved his beard and combed his hair,
And straightened out his one good pair.

A rhyming couplet:
The clock struck twelve above the door,
The same as it had done before.

A rhyming couplet:
A wagon rattled down the slope,
He held on tightly to the rope.

A rhyming couplet:
The morning mist had veiled the town,
As soft and pale as any gown.

A rhyming couplet:
A cannon roared across the field,
And forced the charging troops to yield.

A rhyming couplet:
A squall came in without a sign,
And snapped the washing from the line.

A rhyming couplet:
The jungle path was dense and green,
The thickest that they'd ever seen.

A rhyming couplet:
A busker played a worn guitar,
Outside the corner coffee bar.

A rhyming couplet:
He shucked the corn and husked the ear,
The harvest supper drawing near.

A rhyming couplet:
The army gathered on the hill,
The battlefield was cold and still.

A rhyming couplet:
A bolt of lightning split the oak,
And left behind a trail of smoke.

A rhyming couplet:
The starboard lantern swung and swayed,
As every timber creaked and played.

A rhyming couplet:
He fixed the hinge upon the gate,
And closed it shut before too late.

A rhyming couplet:
The rooster crowed at break of light,
The first to end the farmer's night.

A rhyming couplet:
He read the paper on the bench,
Beside the park's old iron fence.

A rhyming couplet:
He heard a whisper in the wall,
That echoed down the empty hall.

A rhyming couplet:
He heard a rustling in the brush,
And everything fell into hush.

A rhyming couplet:
The printer pressed the metal type,
And wiped each letter with a swipe.

A rhyming couplet:
He carved a flute from hollow reed,
The only music he would need.

A rhyming couplet:
The mushrooms formed a fairy ring,
Where nothing grew but one small thing.

A rhyming couplet:
He tapped his foot to keep the beat,
And drummed his fingers on the seat.

A rhyming couplet:
The banquet hall was draped in red,
With golden cloth and silver thread.

A rhyming couplet:
He milked the cow before the dawn,
While mist still lingered on the lawn.

A rhyming couplet:
The jazz band played until the dawn,
Long after every guest had gone.

A rhyming couplet:
A patch of ice along the stair,
Sent him tumbling through the air.

A rhyming couplet:
The neighbor's fence was freshly white,
He'd painted it the previous night.

A rhyming couplet:
He lit a match to start the flame,
And whispered someone else's name.

A rhyming couplet:
A gentle breeze came off the shore,
As sweet as any spring before.

A rhyming couplet:
A foghorn bellowed in the gray,
To warn the boats to stay away.

A rhyming couplet:
He opened up the wooden chest,
And found a letter from a guest.

A rhyming couplet:
A bear emerged to catch the fish,
The salmon was its only wish.

A rhyming couplet:
A single seed fell in the dirt,
And pushed through soil with all its worth.

A rhyming couplet:
The sunset burned through smoky haze,
And closed the longest of the days.

A rhyming couplet:
The pen ran dry, the page half done,
His final chapter just begun.

A rhyming couplet:
The drought had cracked the river bed,
And left the cattle barely fed.

A rhyming couplet:
The plumber fixed the broken main,
And water flowed back once again.

A rhyming couplet:
The magnet pulled the iron nail,
Across the table without fail.

A rhyming couplet:
The frog sat still upon the log,
Half hidden in the morning fog.

A rhyming couplet:
She danced beneath the summer rain,
And pressed her face against the pane.

A rhyming couplet:
The gears all clicked and locked in line,
A perfect piece of grand design.

A rhyming couplet:
She left a rose beside his door,
The same kind he had loved before.

A rhyming couplet:
The soup was simmering with thyme,
And smelled like something quite sublime.

A rhyming couplet:
The harvest moon hung fat and low,
And lit the fields from row to row.

A rhyming couplet:
The barn owl nested in the loft,
Its feathers white and smooth and soft.

A rhyming couplet:
He launched a kite into the storm,
To catch the lightning's electric form.

A rhyming couplet:
The woodsman sharpened up his ax,
And followed old familiar tracks.

A rhyming couplet:
The heat had wilted every bloom,
And filled the house with stifling gloom.

A rhyming couplet:
The market stalls had plum and peach,
All ripe and warm and within reach.

A rhyming couplet:
A trellis held the climbing bean,
The tallest plant the yard had seen.

A rhyming couplet:
A goat had climbed the steepest ridge,
And crossed the river on a bridge.

A rhyming couplet:
He raised the flag of crimson red,
In honor of the newly wed.

A rhyming couplet:
A music box began to chime,
Its melody like frozen time.

A rhyming couplet:
A crow sat perched upon a post,
As silent as a wandering ghost.

A rhyming couplet:
The stag stood tall beside the stream,
Its antlers catching morning's gleam.

A rhyming couplet:
The thunder cracked across the sky,
And made the smallest children cry.

A rhyming couplet:
The hailstones bounced along the tin,
And dented every roof they'd been.

A rhyming couplet:
A magnifying glass revealed,
The secrets that the text concealed.

A rhyming couplet:
The ranger marked the trail with paint,
Each blaze a bright and welcome saint.

A rhyming couplet:
The telescope was aimed at Mars,
Beyond the flicker of the stars.

A rhyming couplet:
The mason laid the cornerstone,
A job he'd always done alone.

A rhyming couplet:
The violinist drew the bow,
And played a melody so slow.

A rhyming couplet:
She planted tulips by the fence,
Their colors deep and bright and dense.

A rhyming couplet:
A jeweler polished every stone,
Until its hidden beauty shone.

A rhyming couplet:
A finch was nesting in the eave,
And wouldn't stir or ever leave.

A rhyming couplet:
The snake had coiled beneath a rock,
And struck as fast as any clock.

A rhyming couplet:
He roasted peppers on the flame,
No two of them would taste the same.

A rhyming couplet:
The conductor raised his hand up high,
And silence fell before the cry.

A rhyming couplet:
The sun broke through the heavy cloud,
And lit the faces of the crowd.

A rhyming couplet:
The enchanted mirror showed the past,
A vision that was not to last.

A rhyming couplet:
The mailman left a heavy box,
Beside the garden's hollyhocks.

A rhyming couplet:
The railroad stretched from coast to coast,
Through every town and trading post.

A rhyming couplet:
The ferry left without a sound,
And slowly turned the cape around.

A rhyming couplet:
A violin played all on its own,
Inside a house of dust and bone.

A rhyming couplet:
The weaver threaded every loom,
In silence from her tiny room.

A rhyming couplet:
A loaf of bread was split in two,
Enough for me and just for you.

A rhyming couplet:
She threaded beads upon a wire,
Each color burning bright like fire.

A rhyming couplet:
The puddles mirrored every tree,
As still as any lake could be.

A rhyming couplet:
She found a key inside the drawer,
But couldn't tell what it was for.

A rhyming couplet:
A dragon coiled around its hoard,
And slept beside a golden sword.

A rhyming couplet:
A taxi waited by the curb,
In silence, no one said a word.

A rhyming couplet:
He welded pipes beneath the street,
In tunnels dark with summer heat.

A rhyming couplet:
The battlefield fell deathly quiet,
After the raging storm of riot.

A rhyming couplet:
A gust of wind swept through the grass,
And bent it flat until it passed.

A rhyming couplet:
The owl hooted from the pine,
Its golden eyes began to shine.

A rhyming couplet:
The silence grew between the two,
A wall that neither one broke through.

A rhyming couplet:
A manuscript was stained with age,
Its wisdom fading page by page.

A rhyming couplet:
A mirror cracked from edge to frame,
And no reflection looked the same.

A rhyming couplet:
The letter read in trembling hands,
Revealed the end of all their plans.

A rhyming couplet:
The cat stretched out across the stair,
And flicked its tail without a care.

A rhyming couplet:
The wildflowers opened wide at dawn,
By afternoon they all were gone.

A rhyming couplet:
She climbed the tower's spiral stair,
To feel the wind blow through her hair.

A rhyming couplet:
A cobweb stretched across the door,
No one had entered there before.

A rhyming couplet:
The butter melted on the toast,
The simple things she loved the most.

A rhyming couplet:
He counted rings inside the stump,
And felt his weary heartbeat thump.

A rhyming couplet:
A kite got tangled in the tree,
Too high for any child to free.

A rhyming couplet:
A willow drooped beside the stream,
Its branches drifting like a dream.

A rhyming couplet:
The treaty signed in fading ink,
Had brought the kingdoms to the brink.

A rhyming couplet:
The jester danced before the court,
His comedy of every sort.

A rhyming couplet:
A bowl of stew sat by the fire,
Its warmth the only true desire.

A rhyming couplet:
She left a trail of golden thread,
Through winding halls that filled with dread.

A rhyming couplet:
The ship went down without its mast,
And sank before the storm had passed.

A rhyming couplet:
A sundial marked the hour's turn,
As shadows stretched along the fern.

A rhyming couplet:
She watered every pot and plant,
With all the patience of a saint.

A rhyming couplet:
She pulled the curtain back to peek,
The moonlight landing on her cheek.

A rhyming couplet:
A flower shop bloomed behind the glass,
A burst of color as you'd pass.

A rhyming couplet:
The diary's last page was torn,
The final entry lost and worn.

A rhyming couplet:
A dust storm blew across the land,
And buried fences deep in sand.

A rhyming couplet:
A falcon perched upon the glove,
The king's most treasured hunting love.

A rhyming couplet:
The scholar dipped his quill in ink,
And paused a heavy breath to think.

A rhyming couplet:
The photograph had turned to gold,
A memory too dear to hold.

A rhyming couplet:
The pasta boiled inside the pot,
The water hissing, thick and hot.

A rhyming couplet:
She heard the rumble in the east,
The storm approaching like a beast.

A rhyming couplet:
A scarecrow leaned against the post,
More ragged than the morning's ghost.

A rhyming couplet:
The tapestry was old and torn,
Depicting kings of ages born.

A rhyming couplet:
A clock tower rose above the square,
Its face was visible from everywhere.

A rhyming couplet:
She whipped the cream until it peaked,
The wooden spoon she held had creaked.

A rhyming couplet:
The queen decreed a royal feast,
From west to east and priest to beast.

A rhyming couplet:
The seesaw tipped from end to end,
With laughter shared between each friend.

A rhyming couplet:
A spider's web caught morning dew,
And sparkled in a silver hue.

A rhyming couplet:
A sorcerer opened up the rift,
And let the shadows start to drift.

A rhyming couplet:
The channel narrowed at the strait,
And every ship was forced to wait.

A rhyming couplet:
She catalogued each book and tome,
And organized the knowledge dome.

A rhyming couplet:
He tied his boots and grabbed his coat,
And read the morning's final note.

A rhyming couplet:
He watched the clouds roll in from sea,
As dark as anything could be.

A rhyming couplet:
A fisherman cast out his net,
The finest catch he'd ever get.

A rhyming couplet:
The anchor dropped into the deep,
Where sunken treasures lay asleep.

A rhyming couplet:
The cobbler stitched the leather sole,
And patched the boot to make it whole.

A rhyming couplet:
A compass pointed to the west,
And so they followed on their quest.

A rhyming couplet:
A wheelbarrow tipped on its side,
With hay and dirt spilled far and wide.

A rhyming couplet:
A whale breached high above the foam,
A hundred miles away from home.

A rhyming couplet:
She ironed every shirt and seam,
While drifting off into a dream.

A rhyming couplet:
He folded every note she wrote,
And kept them in his winter coat.

A rhyming couplet:
A turtle crossed the dusty road,
And carried on its heavy load.

A rhyming couplet:
The rooster crowed before the dawn,
And woke the farmer with a yawn.

A rhyming couplet:
She reached the summit just in time,
To hear the temple's evening chime.

A rhyming couplet:
The elf had crafted every bow,
From branches bent by frost and snow.

A rhyming couplet:
The sunset burned a streak of gold,
A sight that never once grew old.

A rhyming couplet:
The wizard raised his ancient staff,
And split the mountain clean in half.

A rhyming couplet:
The general rode before his men,
And swore he'd never yield again.

A rhyming couplet:
A watchmaker wound tiny springs,
And fastened all the smallest things.

A rhyming couplet:
The courtyard echoed hooves and steel,
As soldiers trained with lance and zeal.

A rhyming couplet:
The timber wolf let out a cry,
Beneath the cold November sky.

A rhyming couplet:
The creek ran dry beneath the sun,
Its winding journey nearly done.

A rhyming couplet:
The painting's eyes would seem to track,
Each person walking front to back.

A rhyming couplet:
The archer crouched behind the wall,
And waited for the order's call.

A rhyming couplet:
The snowman wore a crooked hat,
With button eyes and scarf and that.

A rhyming couplet:
The frost had crept across the lake,
And nothing stirred for winter's sake.

A rhyming couplet:
The attic door was locked from in,
And something moved beneath the din.

A rhyming couplet:
A glassblower shaped the molten sphere,
As fragile as a frozen tear.

A rhyming couplet:
A trapdoor hidden by the mat,
Led somewhere dark and cold and flat.

A rhyming couplet:
The barnacles had claimed the hull,
And slowed the ship to half its pull.

A rhyming couplet:
The forest floor was thick with fern,
And every path became a turn.

A rhyming couplet:
The flute let out a haunting sound,
That echoed miles below the ground.

A rhyming couplet:
The dungeon dripped with cold and damp,
The only light a single lamp.

A rhyming couplet:
He ground the coffee fresh at dawn,
Before the morning dew was gone.

A rhyming couplet:
A paper airplane crossed the room,
And landed right beside the broom.

A rhyming couplet:
A cabin sat among the pines,
With lantern light and wooden signs.

A rhyming couplet:
The slide was hot beneath the sun,
But every trip was so much fun.

A rhyming couplet:
The sidewalk cracked beneath the tree,
Its roots had spread completely free.

A rhyming couplet:
A trumpet sounded through the vale,
And knights rode forth in coats of mail.

A rhyming couplet:
The bubbles floated in the breeze,
Above the rooftops and the trees.

A rhyming couplet:
She heard the church bells start to ring,
A sound that made the whole town sing.

A rhyming couplet:
The crab crept sideways on the shore,
And ducked into the sandy floor.

A rhyming couplet:
A letter landed on the mat,
Beside a purring orange cat.

A rhyming couplet:
The baker kneaded fresh warm bread,
Enough to keep a village fed.

A rhyming couplet:
The blacksmith hammered red-hot steel,
And shaped a blade with spark and zeal.

A rhyming couplet:
The landlord came to check the rent,
And wondered where the money went.

A rhyming couplet:
The drawbridge lowered with a groan,
Its chains as heavy as the stone.

A rhyming couplet:
She wore the dress of faded white,
From that one unforgettable night.

A rhyming couplet:
He waited underneath the arch,
As snowflakes fell to end the march.

A rhyming couplet:
A tree had fallen in the storm,
Its shape already losing form.

A rhyming couplet:
The autumn leaves began to fall,
And painted gold across the wall.

A rhyming couplet:
The radio crackled, then went dead,
A silence filling them with dread.

A rhyming couplet:
She pruned the roses one by one,
Beneath the warm September sun.

A rhyming couplet:
The satellite passed overhead,
A blinking dot of flashing red.

A rhyming couplet:
He sharpened every edge and blade,
Before the march into the raid.

A rhyming couplet:
A raven tapped upon the glass,
And watched her through it as she passed.

A rhyming couplet:
She sharpened arrows by the fire,
The flames reflecting anger's ire.

A rhyming couplet:
He caught a cricket in a jar,
And held it up to see a star.

A rhyming couplet:
He stacked the bricks up row by row,
As steady as the tide below.

A rhyming couplet:
The magic wand was carved from yew,
And crackled when the night wind blew.

A rhyming couplet:
The window where she used to wait,
Still faced the garden and the gate.

A rhyming couplet:
The garden gate swung open wide,
With no one standing on the side.

A rhyming couplet:
The trail was lined with fallen leaves,
Beneath the canopy of trees.

A rhyming couplet:
She watched the frost paint on the glass,
A frozen garden, field and grass.

A rhyming couplet:
The lamb had wandered from the flock,
And stumbled on a jagged rock.

A rhyming couplet:
The goodbye lasted far too long,
Like the ending of a bittersweet song.

A rhyming couplet:
A squire trained with lance and shield,
Upon the castle's muddy field.

A rhyming couplet:
She watched the cherry blossoms bloom,
Their scent had filled the tiny room.

A rhyming couplet:
The moat was black and still and wide,
With something lurking just inside.

A rhyming couplet:
The border gate was locked at dusk,
The air still thick with desert musk.

A rhyming couplet:
She wore a cloak of silver thread,
That shimmered everywhere she tread.

A rhyming couplet:
The irrigation ditch ran dry,
Beneath the hot and cloudless sky.

A rhyming couplet:
A rover rolled on Martian sand,
Obeying every planned command.

A rhyming couplet:
He polished every jewel and crown,
The brightest treasure in the town.

A rhyming couplet:
The trumpet blared a bright fanfare,
That shook the dust from every chair.

A rhyming couplet:
A harpist plucked a golden string,
And made the empty rafters ring.

A rhyming couplet:
The cellar stairs went down and down,
Beneath the sleepy little town.

A rhyming couplet:
She colored outside every line,
And thought the picture looked just fine.

A rhyming couplet:
He searched the room from wall to shelf,
And found a portrait of himself.

A rhyming couplet:
She turned the pages one by one,
And couldn't stop until she's done.

A rhyming couplet:
The clock struck one and nothing stirred,
Except the hooting of a bird.

A rhyming couplet:
He mended every fence and stile,
And walked the boundary for a mile.

A rhyming couplet:
He hid behind the garden shed,
And waited there with bated dread.

A rhyming couplet:
A pirate drew his tattered map,
And planned the final treasure trap.

A rhyming couplet:
The heron waited still and keen,
The sharpest eye the marsh had seen.

A rhyming couplet:
A chimney swept the rooftop clean,
The tallest stack the town had seen.

A rhyming couplet:
A field of lavender in bloom,
Had chased away the winter's gloom.

A rhyming couplet:
A handkerchief was soaked with tears,
The sum of all her silent years.

A rhyming couplet:
She gathered herbs from every bed,
Of rosemary and thyme and shred.

A rhyming couplet:
The grocery list was long and wide,
She tucked it in her pocket's side.

A rhyming couplet:
She polished every glass and plate,
And set them out before the eight.

A rhyming couplet:
The ocean roared against the cliff,
And carved the rock into a rift.

A rhyming couplet:
The broth was rich with bone and marrow,
Its flavor deep but never narrow.

A rhyming couplet:
A painter mixed her shade of blue,
The rarest and the deepest hue.

A rhyming couplet:
He whistled tunes along the lane,
A cheerful sound despite the rain.

A rhyming couplet:
The winding road went through the pass,
Between the boulders and the grass.

A rhyming couplet:
She underlined each word she read,
In blue and green and sometimes red.

A rhyming couplet:
A prism caught the beam of white,
And split it into bands of light.

A rhyming couplet:
She crossed the river on a raft,
And laughed against the current's draft.

A rhyming couplet:
He hummed the song she used to sing,
And twisted slowly at his ring.

A rhyming couplet:
The enchantress wove a binding chain,
That held the beast in constant pain.

A rhyming couplet:
A caravan crossed shifting sand,
Toward the border of the land.

A rhyming couplet:
He tramped through mud and morning dew,
Along a trail that no one knew.

A rhyming couplet:
The bench still had their carved-out date,
A love that came a year too late.

A rhyming couplet:
A phoenix rose from ash and spark,
And lit a blaze against the dark.

A rhyming couplet:
The inkwell spilled across the page,
A blotch that spread from age to age.

A rhyming couplet:
He crossed the desert mile by mile,
Without a rest or shade or smile.

A rhyming couplet:
A giant slumbered in the cave,
No army was enough to brave.

A rhyming couplet:
He sat on roots beside the stream,
And drifted off into a dream.

A rhyming couplet:
She wired the circuit board by hand,
Exactly how she'd always planned.

A rhyming couplet:
A candle flickered on the stair,
But no one else was standing there.

A rhyming couplet:
She measured waves upon a chart,
And mapped the signals from the start.

A rhyming couplet:
A sandpit held a buried prize,
She dug it up with wide, bright eyes.

A rhyming couplet:
The compass spun without a stop,
Until the needle reached the top.

A rhyming couplet:
She walked along the sandy shore,
And found a shell she'd seen before.

A rhyming couplet:
She sailed around the cape at dawn,
Before the eastern stars were gone.

A rhyming couplet:
She soldered wires thin as hair,
With steady hands and focused stare.

A rhyming couplet:
The hopscotch grid was drawn in chalk,
She hopped it through without a talk.

A rhyming couplet:
The homework piled up past her ears,
The pressure building into tears.

A rhyming couplet:
The engine whirred and came to life,
Cutting through the air like a knife.

A rhyming couplet:
A beetle landed on his hat,
He swatted it and knocked it flat.

A rhyming couplet:
The rain came down in heavy sheets,
And flooded every road and street.

A rhyming couplet:
The circuit sparked and hummed alive,
The current surging through the drive.

A rhyming couplet:
He hitchhiked down a lonely road,
And helped a stranger with their load.

A rhyming couplet:
The perfume lingered on the sheet,
A scent both bitter and so sweet.

A rhyming couplet:
The trailhead vanished in the green,
Beyond a place she'd ever been.

A rhyming couplet:
The warship bristled deck to deck,
With cannons pointed at the wreck.

A rhyming couplet:
A thesis bound in leather brown,
Was praised by every judge in town.

A rhyming couplet:
The horn of battle filled the air,
And echoed off the mountains bare.

A rhyming couplet:
A message washed up in a jar,
From someone sailing very far.

A rhyming couplet:
The mountain pass was steep and narrow,
He gripped the reins and dodged the arrow.

A rhyming couplet:
The astronaut looked down at Earth,
And marveled at its fragile worth.

A rhyming couplet:
He waited by the station clock,
And paced along the empty dock.

A rhyming couplet:
A music box played their old tune,
Beneath the pale September moon.

A rhyming couplet:
She raised the banner, torn and frayed,
And led the final, desperate raid.

A rhyming couplet:
The empty chair beside the fire,
Was all that fed his heart's desire.

A rhyming couplet:
The ivy wrapped around the oak,
As if the tree would soon be choked.

A rhyming couplet:
A library held a thousand tales,
Of kings and knights and ships with sails.

A rhyming couplet:
She canned the peaches from the tree,
Enough for all the family.

A rhyming couplet:
She baked a cake with lemon zest,
The guests declared it was the best.

A rhyming couplet:
She opened up the dictionary,
And found a word contradictory.

A rhyming couplet:
She dove beneath the turquoise wave,
And found the entrance to a cave.

A rhyming couplet:
He followed stars to find his way,
And walked from nightfall into day.

A rhyming couplet:
She plotted every star in place,
Across the darkness of deep space.

A rhyming couplet:
The swan glided across the lake,
Without a ripple in its wake.

A rhyming couplet:
He rowed his dinghy through the mist,
The shoreline barely did exist.

A rhyming couplet:
She penned a ballad late at night,
By nothing but a candle's light.

A rhyming couplet:
He carved their names into the bark,
And met her every day at dark.

A rhyming couplet:
The children splashed in muddy rain,
And drew their pictures on the pane.

A rhyming couplet:
The ocean floor was dark and vast,
With bones of ships from ages past.

A rhyming couplet:
She danced alone inside the hall,
Her shadow stretching down the wall.

A rhyming couplet:
The goblin guarded every door,
That led to treasure under floor.

A rhyming couplet:
The tractor rumbled through the field,
To plow the earth and break its yield.

A rhyming couplet:
The canopy blocked out the sky,
No beam of light could travel by.

A rhyming couplet:
The wolf howled underneath the moon,
The forest answered back in tune.

A rhyming couplet:
The map was torn along the fold,
But led to treasures yet untold.

A rhyming couplet:
The mud was ankle-deep and thick,
He pulled his boot out with a flick.

A rhyming couplet:
A diary locked without a key,
Held secrets no one else should see.

A rhyming couplet:
A kettle whistled on the stove,
She poured the tea with care and love.

A rhyming couplet:
He saved one photograph alone,
And kept it close beside the phone.

A rhyming couplet:
A pie sat cooling on the ledge,
Its golden crust a flaky edge.

A rhyming couplet:
She argued every single point,
The sharpest student in the joint.

A rhyming couplet:
The icicles hung from the eave,
Too beautiful for her to leave.

A rhyming couplet:
The pendulum kept steady time,
Its rhythm almost like a rhyme.

A rhyming couplet:
The trenches filled with mud and rain,
As soldiers bore the cold and pain.

A rhyming couplet:
The textbook weighed a solid pound,
The heaviest the class had found.

A rhyming couplet:
The sleet was stinging on the face,
No shelter found in any place.

A rhyming couplet:
He sketched a diagram with care,
Each angle measured to the hair.

A rhyming couplet:
The cavalry broke through the line,
Their sabers flashing steel and shine.

A rhyming couplet:
The roots had split the earth apart,
The oldest oak stood at the heart.

A rhyming couplet:
She paddled down the winding stream,
Through forests out of some old dream.

A rhyming couplet:
The forest smelled of bark and rain,
A scent she'd never find again.

A rhyming couplet:
She traced the orbit of the moon,
And knew the eclipse was coming soon.

A rhyming couplet:
He climbed the fire escape at night,
To see the rooftop city's light.

A rhyming couplet:
The exam was set for half past nine,
He crammed all night and felt just fine.

A rhyming couplet:
The lullaby was soft and sweet,
And rocked the baby off to sleep.

A rhyming couplet:
He practiced every letter's shape,
His pencil making no escape.

A rhyming couplet:
The dew had settled on the thorn,
And sparkled in the early morn.

A rhyming couplet:
A footprint marked the dusty stair,
Left by someone who'd been there.

A rhyming couplet:
The northern lights danced green and bright,
A curtain draped across the night.

A rhyming couplet:
A fossil pressed inside the clay,
Had waited there for years to stay.

A rhyming couplet:
She tossed the salad, fresh and green,
The crispest leaves she'd ever seen.

A rhyming couplet:
The fox slipped through a gap in stone,
And vanished in the dark alone.

A rhyming couplet:
The hound picked up a rabbit's trail,
And chased it past the wooden rail.

A rhyming couplet:
The subway rumbled underground,
A deep and ever-present sound.

A rhyming couplet:
He carved a boat from driftwood plank,
And launched it from the muddy bank.

A rhyming couplet:
He pitched the hay up in the barn,
And wound the baling wire like yarn.

A rhyming couplet:
A jar of jam sat on the shelf,
She'd picked the berries by herself.

A rhyming couplet:
The elf had crafted every bow,
From branches of the oldest yew below.

A rhyming couplet:
The microscope revealed a cell,
A universe too small to tell.

A rhyming couplet:
The alarm went off at half past four,
He hit the button, wanting more.

A rhyming couplet:
He climbed the ridge to see the view,
And watched the sky from gray to blue.

A rhyming couplet:
The mushrooms sprouted after rain,
And dotted every muddy lane.

A rhyming couplet:
The ginger snapped between his teeth,
Its fire spreading underneath.
